isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 9000 Pro Sleeper After 05/01/1997, and 9800 Model After 07/01/1997 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BLOWER MOTOR ASSEMBLy - CAB (LOCATED IN Blend-Air Unit)

svcproc.title: BLOWER MOTOR ASSEMBLy - CAB (LOCATED IN Blend-Air Unit)

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and blower motor switch are in the OFF position.
Remove the passenger seat and Blend-Air unit cover. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Remove .
Remove two screws from the front side of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 37).
Remove two screws from the blower motor housing where it is fastened to the inside of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 38).
Disconnect the electrical connector from the motor.

caution.para: In the following step, take care not to damage the resistors while handling the blower speed resistor housing.

step1.para: Slide the blower speed resistor housing up and out of the Blend-Air unit and lay it out of the way ( Figure 41).
Slide the blower housing back and up to remove ( Figure 39).
If the motor is to be replaced, remove the five screws that secure the blower motor assembly to the blower housing and remove the blower motor assembly ( Figure 40).

figure.caption: Figure 40. Screws Securing Blower Motor Assembly

step1.para: If the blower wheel must be separated from motor, to allow replacement of individual parts, remove the clip from the end of the motor shaft and slide the wheel off of the motor shaft.
Inspect the blower wheel for damage. Replace if damaged.
If the blower wheel was removed, install the wheel onto the motor shaft until it bottoms out; then, install the clip onto the motor shaft to hold the wheel in position.
Install the blower motor assembly in the blower housing with the five screws removed in Step 8 of Remove above ( Figure 40).
Position blower motor housing in Blend-Air unit ( Figure 39), and reconnect the electrical connector to the motor.
While holding the blower motor housing in place, install and tighten two screws through the front side of the Blend-Air unit into the blower motor housing ( Figure 37).
Install and tighten the two screws that secure the blower motor housing to the inside of the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 38).
Slide the blower speed resistor housing back into the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 41).

note.para: In the following step, to verify correct blower operation at the air duct outlets, the cover must be in place on the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Install Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat. Refer to BLEND-AIR UNIT COVER, Install .
